did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Ralph Stockman Tarr papers, 1883-1961, 1883-1912 (bulk)
did.physdesc: Correspondence, field notebooks, research material, publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Tarr's papers mainly pertaining to geography.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers include irrigation surveys of western states, 1883-1889; pictures of the Peary Arctic Expedition of 1896; diary of the expedition by B. Hoppin; scrapbook kept by Tarr as a Cornell professor; geology field books; notebooks of his son, Russel S. Tarr; diary kept on the Cornell Alaska Expedition, 1906; lectures on the geography of North America; notes on lab work in an experimental physiography course, 1907-1908; glass slides and negatives; and correspondence on Tarr's early years. Also, Geology Department records and reports kept by Tarr and his successors and a ledger of information on graduate students in the Geology Department.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Ralph Stockman Tarr papers, #14-15-92. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey maps; publication on the Greenland expedition; Alaska-Yukon Magazine, April, 1909; Scrapbook of memorabilia from various geological society meetings; much loose material, includes TLS from Theodore Roosevelt

Photographs and postcards from Greenland; published diary of Peary Arctic Expedition of 1896; Volume - Dept. records and correspondence, 1892-1894; reports and correspondence, 1895-1914 (Tarr and von Engeln); reports and correspondence, 1910-1962 (Tarr and von Engeln)
